title: L'Oreal Shares soar after sales top estimates
text:
Shares in L'Oreal SA (OR.FR) jumped higher Wednesday after the company reported strong third-quarter sales growth on Tuesday evening, beating analysts' expectations.

The French cosmetics and consumer-products giant reported sales of 7.18 billion euros ($7.96 billion), up 7.8% on a like-for-like basis and above analyst expectations of EUR7.03 billion, according to a consensus estimate provided by Factset.

L'Oreal delivered an impressive performance despite high comparison bases and the disruption it faced from protests in Hong Kong, Berenberg analysts said. Its results also didn't show any signs of growth slowdown in China, which is good news since this is a problem for several of its competitors, RBC analysts said.

At 1124 GMT, shares in L'Oreal traded 7% higher at EUR261.70.

On a reported basis, sales were up 11% from the same period the previous year, L'Oreal said.

Growth was once again spurred by the luxe and active cosmetic divisions, both of which posted like-for-like sales growth of 14%. The Asia-Pacific region, travel retail, skincare and e-commerce continued to drive growth, too, L'Oreal said.

Citi analysts liked the jump recorded in e-commerce sales, which grew 48% like-for-like, accounting for more than 80% of L'Oreal's total growth for the quarter by the bank's estimates. "With growth now entirely driven by new channels, portfolio breadth becomes a sustainable driver to outperform a market where shelf space is now a less relevant concept," Citi analysts said.

According to L'Oreal management's estimates, the broader beauty market grew by about 5.5% in the quarter, which means the company outpaced the market and continued to gain share, Berenberg analysts said.

On the negative side, sales in North America declined on a like-for-like basis. This was due in part to weakness in the U.S. makeup market, especially as some of L'Oreal's brands struggle to adapt to a shift toward more natural makeup trends, Jefferies analysts said.

For 2019, the company reiterated its confidence that it can outperform the market and grow its sales and profit.
